were sent to Longxing Temple in Yue Prefecture.

In the 21st year of the Zhenyuan era of the Great Tang Dynasty, the year of Yiyou, on the 13th day of the 5th month, the 13th day of the Jiazi month, the 13th day of the Xinsi month, the monk SaichÅ of Japan, who sought the Dharma, recorded it. The monk Yishin of Japan, who translated the Dharma, recorded it. The attendant monk FukujÅ of Japan, who sought the Dharma, recorded it. Confucius said:
I have heard that
in the West there is a sage
whose teachings take purity and non-action as the basis.
Not being stained or attached is wonderful.
In transforming people,
endowed with merit,
it becomes perfect and bright.
Master SaichÅ
has a nature endowed with the talent of innate knowledge.
He comes from a country of propriety and righteousness.
Traveling ten thousand miles to seek the Dharma,
he regards danger as if it were level ground.
He does not shrink from hardship and toil.
With the protection of spiritual power,ğŸ”½he ascended to the peak of Tiantai in the south.
He crossed the waters of Jinghu in the west.
He exhausted the Dharma gate of Zhizhe.
He explored the divine mysteries of Guanding.
Can be called the dragon and elephant of the Dharma gate.
Like a blue lotus emerging from the pond.
Taking this Mahayana teaching to transmit to his home country.
Seeking this seal of approval to hold as a basis.
Recently, Lu, the Prefect of Taizhou, has already inscribed a record.
Therefore, I have recorded what I have seen and have submitted a straightforward account.
On the fifteenth day of the fifth month in the twenty-first year of the Zhenyuan era of the Great Tang Dynasty.
Written by Zheng Shenze, the Prefect of Mingzhou, the General of the Military Affairs of Mingzhou, the Defender-General of Mingzhou, the Supervisor of the State, and the Duke of Xingyang.

The Catalogue of the Shanjia School, Preface: In the past, when our three sages went to Tang China to seek the Dharma,
They all had a catalogue of what they brought back.
It was published in the world long ago.
Now, this copy is made again.
It is to prevent the original from decaying.
The prosperity of cultural artifacts in the imperial court.
Whether it is Buddhist or secular.
None surpasses the holy reigns of Enryaku and KÅnin.
As for the refined and subtle calligraphy,
The calligraphers of the late Tang dynasty and after are truly unable to reach it.
People all know it.
A Song person praised it, saying it is almost like the two kings, which is not false.
Even at that time, it was like this.
How much more so now, with only a few thousand characters remaining in the world.
It can be called a rare treasure of the world.
However, it is kept in a secret place.
Not only are few people aware of it,
I am afraid that it may not be able to be completely preserved for later generations.
How can one not feel regret?
Now, in the summer of the Xinsi year.
The monk ChÅkÅ of HÅman brought a copy of the original and said:
One thousand years have passed since the Great Master entered nirvana.
The original work can still be seen now.
Now it is carved and placed in the KaidÅ TÅin.
It will be passed down for generations to come, and is not it a splendid sight?
At this, we snap our fingers in delight and agree.
Recently, the woodblocks have been completed.
Those in the Dharma are earnestly requesting a title.
I firmly declined and did not allow it.
Therefore, without regard, I only ask for the beginning and end to be written in a document.ğŸ”½On the self-admittance day of the monks in the Xinsi year of the Wenzheng era.
